channel.title: Whonix on Mac m1 Max Problem with sdwdate
channel.description:
in Whonix-Gateway-XFCE In sdwdate logs: + terminal_emulator_window_title='sdwdate Log Viewer' + /usr/libexec/helper-scripts/terminal-wrapper 'sudo --non-interactive /usr/bin/sdwdate-log-viewer' sdwdate-gui : TTY=pts/0 ; PWD=/run/sdwdate-gui ; USER=root ; COMMAND=/usr/bin/sdwdate-log-viewer - sdwdate reports: Preparation not done yet. More more information, see: sdwdate-gui -> right click -> Open sdwdate's log ____ ### START: ### /usr/sbin/anondate-set ____ INFO: Status file '/run/sdwdate/tor_certificate_lifetime_set' does not yet exist. ____ INFO: Running anondate-get... ______ ### START: ### /usr/sbin/anondate-get ____ INFO: anondate-get returned Tor consensus middle range time or minimum time. ____ INFO: The 'anondate-get' time_result is earlier than the current system time, ok. Not setting clock backwards. ____ ### END: ### Exiting with exit_code '3' indicating 'Setting time using anondate either not possible or not required.'. - sdwdate reports: Preparation not done yet. More more information, see: sdwdate-gui -> right click -> Open sdwdate's log
What I need to do to fix this?

item.title: Whonix on Mac m1 Max Problem with sdwdate
item.dc:creator: kesha
item.description:
I found a solution, I just had to set the system time a couple of hours earlier

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix on Mac m1 Max Problem with sdwdate

item.title: Whonix on Mac m1 Max Problem with sdwdate
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
A general connectivity issue? No connectivity is functional or only sdwdate isn’t functional?

If there is no connectivity whatsoever, see
Unsuitable Connectivity Troubleshooting Tools

If sdwdate is the only broken thing, full sdwdate log is required.

Read full topic

See Pasting Logs for Support.

Does https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Reporting_Bugs#Out_of_Scope_Issues apply?

item.source: Whonix on Mac m1 Max Problem with sdwdate

item.title: Whonix on Mac m1 Max Problem with sdwdate
item.dc:creator: kesha
item.description:
in Whonix-Gateway-XFCE
In sdwdate logs:

  • terminal_emulator_window_title=‘sdwdate Log Viewer’
  • /usr/libexec/helper-scripts/terminal-wrapper ‘sudo --non-interactive /usr/bin/sdwdate-log-viewer’
    sdwdate-gui : TTY=pts/0 ; PWD=/run/sdwdate-gui ; USER=root ; COMMAND=/usr/bin/sdwdate-log-viewer
  • sdwdate reports: Preparation not done yet. More more information, see: sdwdate-gui → right click → Open sdwdate’s log
    ____ ### START: ### /usr/sbin/anondate-set
    ____ INFO: Status file ‘/run/sdwdate/tor_certificate_lifetime_set’ does not yet exist.
    ____ INFO: Running anondate-get…
    ______ ### START: ### /usr/sbin/anondate-get
    ____ INFO: anondate-get returned Tor consensus middle range time or minimum time.
    ____ INFO: The ‘anondate-get’ time_result is earlier than the current system time, ok. Not setting clock backwards.
    ____ ### END: ### Exiting with exit_code ‘3’ indicating ‘Setting time using anondate either not possible or not required.’.
  • sdwdate reports: Preparation not done yet. More more information, see: sdwdate-gui → right click → Open sdwdate’s log

What I need to do to fix this?

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix on Mac m1 Max Problem with sdwdate
